means: （改变事物、物质的）魔力（或方法）

word_mean: 古代道家或道教徒等以金石类矿物为原料，采用化学方法炼制成自以为令人长生不老而实际上有毒“丹”药的技术与方法。

sentence.Network_en: Richard told me of three 16th-century folio volumes on alchemy.
sentence.Network_cn: 理查德告诉过我16世纪的三卷关于炼金术的对开本书籍的事。

sentence.Network_en: What spurred them on was alchemy, the'science " of changing ordinary metals into gold.
sentence.Network_cn: 激励他们的是炼金术, 即把普通金属变为金子的 “ 科学 ”.

sentence.Network_en: Religion had an intimate association with alchemy during the Middle Ages.
sentence.Network_cn: 在中世纪,宗教和炼金术密切相联.

it is similar the Cathar doctrine and he himself stated that he was restating the Hermetic gnosis and explaining the misunderstood central quest of alchemy .它与卡特里派信条相似，他声称自己正在重新叙述秘传的诺斯替派和解释了对炼金术主要寻求的误解。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : via Old French and medieval Latin from Arabic al-kīmiyā', from al 'the' + kīmiyā' (from Greek khēmia, khēmeia 'art of transmuting metals')

entry.def: Alchemy was a form of chemistry studied in the Middle Ages, which was concerned with trying to discover ways to change ordinary metals into gold.
Alchemy is the power to change or create things in a way which seems mysterious and magical.

example.ex: Let us imagine that by some political alchemy it had been possible to make all men equal.
example.tran: 让我们想象通过某种政治魔力能使人人平等。

means.word_mean: 1. a pseudoscientific forerunner of chemistry in medieval times
2. the way two individuals relate to each other;

sentences.sentence: "their chemistry was wrong from the beginning -- they hated each other"

auth_sentence.content: Newton practiced alchemy; Galileo drew up all those horoscopes.

auth_sentence.content: Gilding pale streams with heavenly alchemy.

sentences.cn: 激励他们的是炼金术，即把普通金属变为金子的“科学”。
